paragraphs.content: Chapter 10
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 10

paragraphs.content: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

paragraphs.content: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

paragraphs.content: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

paragraphs.content: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

paragraphs.content: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

paragraphs.content: Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

paragraphs.content: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

paragraphs.content: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

paragraphs.content: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

paragraphs.content: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

paragraphs.content: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

paragraphs.content: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.

paragraphs.content: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

paragraphs.content: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.

paragraphs.content: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.

paragraphs.content: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

paragraphs.content: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.

paragraphs.content: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.

paragraphs.content: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.

paragraphs.content: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.

paragraphs.content: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.

paragraphs.content: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.

paragraphs.content: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.

paragraphs.content: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

paragraphs.content: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

paragraphs.content: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

paragraphs.content: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fear of the Lord prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

paragraphs.content: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

paragraphs.content: The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The way of the Lord is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

paragraphs.content: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.

paragraphs.content: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.

paragraphs.content: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
